antidebug-detectando-attach.md:    // opcodes to run a jump to the function AntiAttachAbort
antidebug-detectando-attach.md:    BYTE jmpToAntiAttachAbort[] =
antidebug-detectando-attach.md:    { 0xB8, 0xCC, 0xCC, 0xCC, 0xCC,   // mov eax, 0xCCCCCCCC
antidebug-detectando-attach.md:    0xFF, 0xE0 };                     // jmp eax
antidebug-detectando-attach.md:    
antidebug-detectando-attach.md:    // we change 0xCCCCCCCC using a more useful address
antidebug-detectando-attach.md:    *reinterpret_cast<PVOID*>(&jmpToAntiAttachAbort[1]) = AntiAttachAbort; 
antidebug-detectando-attach.md:    
antidebug-detectando-attach.md:    
antidebug-detectando-attach.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    // the well-defined functions are functional blocks of code and have
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    // the same signature, allowing the creation of a pointer array to them
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    void WellDefinedFunction1( args );
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    void WellDefinedFunction2( args );
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    void WellDefinedFunction3( args );
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    //...
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    void WellDefinedFunctionN( args );
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    // this thread stays forever waiting execution commands from some
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    // well-defined function. the parameter that it receives is the function number
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    void ExecutionThread()
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    {
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    	// 2. ad aeternum
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    	while( true )
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    	{
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    		// 5. it runs some well-defined function by number
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    		ExecuteWellDefinedFunction( functionNumber );
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    	}
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    }
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    // the well-defined functions script is an integer array indicating 
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    // the number for the next function that is going to be called
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    int FunctionsToBeCalled[] = { 3, 4, 1, 2, 34, 66, 982, n };
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    int Start()
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    {
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    	// 1. we create the thread that is going to run commands
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    	CreateThread( ExecutionThread );
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    	// 3. for each script item (each function number)
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    	for( int i = 0; i < sizeof(FunctionsToBeCalled); ++i )
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    	{
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    		// 4. tells the thread to run the function number N
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    		TellExecutionThreadToExecuteWellDefinedFunction( FunctionToBeCalled[i] );
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    	}
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    	// 6. end of execution.
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    	return 0;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    } 
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    // filter exceptions that were thrown by the thread below
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    DWORD ExceptionFilterButExecuteWellDefinedFunction()
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    {
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    	// 5. run some well-defined function by number
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    	ExecuteWellDefinedFunction( number );
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    	return EXCEPTION_EXECUTE_HANDLER; // goes to except code
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    }
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    // this thread stays forever waiting execution commands from a 
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    // well-defined function. its "parameter" is the function number
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    void ExecutionThread()
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    {
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    	// 2. ad aeternum
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    	while( true )
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    	{
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    		__try
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    		{
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    			__asm int 3 // breakpoint exception
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    			// it stops the debugger if we have an attached debugger in
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    			// the process, or throws an exception if there is no one
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    		}
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    		__except( ExceptionFilterButExecuteWellDefinedFunction() )
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    		{
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    			// it does nothing. here is NOT where is the code (obvious, huh?)
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    		}
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    		Sleep( someTime ); // give some time
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    	}
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    } 
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    /** @brief Sample demonstrating how to implemente antidebug in a code exception based.
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    @date jul-2007
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    @author Wanderley Caloni
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    */
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    #include <windows.h>
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    #include <iostream>
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    #include <map>
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    #include <sstream>
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    #include <string>
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    #include <stdlib.h>
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    using namespace std;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    // show available commands
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    bool Help(const string&)
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    {
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:       cout << "AntiDebug Test Program\n"
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:          << " Echo string to be printed\n"
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:          << " System command [params]\n"
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:          << " Quit\n\n";
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:       return true;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    }
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    // run system/shell command
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    bool System(const string& cmd)
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    {
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:       system(cmd.c_str());
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:       return true;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    }
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    // print string to output
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    bool Echo(const string& str)
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    {
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:       cout << str << endl;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:       return true;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    }
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    // quit program
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    bool Quit(const string&)
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    {
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:       exit(0);
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:       return false;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    }
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    // minifunctions array
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    bool (* (g_miniFuncs[]) )(const string&) = { Help, System, Echo, Quit };
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    // "minifunction -> index" mapping
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    map<string, int> g_miniFuncIdx;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    // start minifunctions mapping
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    void InitializeMiniFuncIdx()
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    {
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:       g_miniFuncIdx["Help"] = 0;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:       g_miniFuncIdx["System"] = 1;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:       g_miniFuncIdx["Echo"] = 2;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:       g_miniFuncIdx["Quit"] = 3;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    }
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    // last line read from input
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    string g_currentLine;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    // how much time are we going to wait for the next line?
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    const DWORD g_waitTime = 1000;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    // run minifunctions
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    DWORD FilterException()
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    {
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:       DWORD ret = EXCEPTION_CONTINUE_EXECUTION;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:       if( ! g_currentLine.empty() )
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:       {
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:          istringstream line(g_currentLine);
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:          g_currentLine.clear();
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:          string function;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:          string params;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:          line >> function;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:          getline(line, params);
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:          // 5. run some well-defined function by number
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:          if( ! g_miniFuncs[g_miniFuncIdxfunction]  )
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:             ret = EXCEPTION_CONTINUE_SEARCH;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:       }
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:       return ret;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    }
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    DWORD WINAPI AntiDebugThread(PVOID)
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    {
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:       InitializeMiniFuncIdx(); // start minifunction mapping
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:       // 2. ad aeternum (or almost)
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:       while( true )
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:       {
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:          //FilterException();
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:          __try // the extern try waits for an exit command
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:          {
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:             __try // the intern try stays generating exceptions continuously
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:             {
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:                __asm int 3
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:             }
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:             // FilterException is the function who runs minifunctions
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:             __except( FilterException() )
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:             {
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    				// we can put some fake code here
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:             }
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:          }
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:          __except( EXCEPTION_EXECUTE_HANDLER )
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:          {
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:             break; // get out from ad aeternum (to the limbo?)
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:          }
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:          Sleep(g_waitTime);
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:       }
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:       return ERROR_SUCCESS;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    }
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    /** and God said: 'int main!'
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    */
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    int main()
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    {
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:       DWORD ret = ERROR_SUCCESS;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:       DWORD tid = 0;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:       HANDLE antiDebugThr;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:       // 1. we create the thread that is going to run the commands
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:       antiDebugThr = CreateThread(NULL, 0, AntiDebugThread, NULL, 0, &tid);;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:       if( antiDebugThr )
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:       {
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:          // 3. for each item in the script (function numbers)
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:          while( cin )
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:          {
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:             cout << "Type something\n";
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:             // 4. tells the thread to run the function number N
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:             getline(cin, g_currentLine);
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:             if( WaitForSingleObject(antiDebugThr, g_waitTime * 2) != WAIT_TIMEOUT )
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:                break;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:          }
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:          GetExitCodeThread(antiDebugThr, &ret);
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:          CloseHandle(antiDebugThr), antiDebugThr = NULL;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:       }
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:       // 6. end of execution.
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:       return (int) ret;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    } 
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-1.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    // Go back to place pre-defined by the restoration point.
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    void LongJmp(restorePoint)
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    {
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	// Here we will generate an exception to make things difficult.
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	// @todo Make a breakpoint exception and catch it.
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	// 3. We return to the if without using the stack, but from the restoration point.
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	GoBackToTheStartFunction(restorePoint);
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    }
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    // Here everything begins.
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    int Start()
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    {
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	// Obs.: follow the agreement flow according to the numbers.
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	// 1. First pass: we define a restoration point to the return of LongJmp.
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	// 4. Second pass: we go back from the LongJmp function, but this time we get into the else.
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	if( RestorePointDefined() == Defined )
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	{
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    		// 2. We call the function that will return to the if.
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    		LongJmp( if );
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	}
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	else
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	{
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    		// 5. Call the real function, our true target.
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    		CallTheUsefulFunction();
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	}
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	// 6. End of execution.
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	return 0;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    } 
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    jmp_buf env; // Contains the next instruction (stack state).
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    void Func()
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    {
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	// 3. Return using the "nonconventional" way
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	longjmp(env, 1);
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    }
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    void CallFunc()
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    {
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	// 1. If we're setting, returns 0.
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	// 2. If we're returning, returns a value different from 0.
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	if( setjmp(env) == 0 )
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    		Func();
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	int x = 10; // 4. Next instruction.
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    } 
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    /** The only purpose of this function is to generate an exception.
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    */
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    DWORD LongJmp(jmp_buf* env)
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    {
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	__try
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	{
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    		__asm int 3
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	}
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    		__except( EXCEPTION_EXECUTE_HANDLER )
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	{
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    		longjmp(*env, 1);
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	}
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	return ERROR_SUCCESS;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    }
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    /** And God said: 'int main!'
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    */
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    int main()
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    {
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	DWORD ret = ERROR_SUCCESS;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	while( cin )
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	{
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    		string line;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    		cout << "Type something\n";
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    		getline(cin, line);
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    		jmp_buf env;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    		if( setjmp(env) == 0 )
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    		{
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    			LongJmp(&env);
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    		}
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    		else
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    		{
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    			cout << line << endl;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    		}
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	}
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	return (int) ret;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    } 
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    /** Use this macro instead LongJmp
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    */
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    #define ANTIDEBUG(code)
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    {
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	jmp_buf env;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	if( setjmp(env) == 0 )
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	{
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    		LongJmp(&env);
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	}
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	else
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	{
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    		code;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	}
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    }
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    /** And God said: 'int main!'
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    */
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    int main()
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    {
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	DWORD ret = ERROR_SUCCESS;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	while( cin )
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	{
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    		string line;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    		cout << "Type something\n";
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    		getline(cin, line);
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    		ANTIDEBUG(( cout << line << endl ));
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	}
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    	return (int) ret;
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    } 
antidebug-interpretacao-baseada-em-excecao-parte-2.md:    
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    void DebugLoop()
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    {
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    	bool exitLoop = false;
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    	while( ! exitLoop )
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    	{
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    		DEBUG_EVENT debugEvt;
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    		// Wait for some debug event.
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    		WaitForDebugEvent(&debugEvt, INFINITE);
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    		// Let us see what it is about.
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    		switch( debugEvt.dwDebugEventCode )
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    		{
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    			// This one...
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    			// That one...
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    			// Process is going out. We get out the loop and go away.
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    			case EXIT_PROCESS_DEBUG_EVENT:
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    			exitLoop = true;
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    			break;
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    		}
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    		// We need to unfreeze the thread who sent the debug event.
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    		// Otherwise, it stays frozen forever!
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    		ContinueDebugEvent(debugEvt.dwProcessId, debugEvt.dwThreadId, DBG_EXCEPTION_NOT_HANDLED);
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    	}
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    } 
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    /** @brief Antidebug protection based on DebugPort aquisition.
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    * @author Wanderley Caloni (wanderley@caloni.com.br)
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    * @date 2007-08
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    */
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    #include <windows.h>
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    /* Every debugger needs a debugging loop. In this loop it catches
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    debugging events sent by the operating system.
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    */
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    DWORD DebugLoop()
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    {
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    	DWORD ret = ERROR_SUCCESS;
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    	bool exitLoop = false;
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    	while( ! exitLoop )
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    	{
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    		DEBUG_EVENT debugEvt;
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    		WaitForDebugEvent(&debugEvt, INFINITE);
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    		switch( debugEvt.dwDebugEventCode )
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    		{
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    			// Process going out. We get out the loop and leave.
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    			case EXIT_PROCESS_DEBUG_EVENT:
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    			exitLoop = true;
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    			break;
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    		}
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    		// Necessary, since the current thread is frozen.
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    		ContinueDebugEvent(debugEvt.dwProcessId, debugEvt.dwThreadId, DBG_EXCEPTION_NOT_HANDLED);
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    	}
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    	return ret;
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    }
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    /* Attachs to the protected process againt debugging. Actually, we protect it
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    againt debugging being its debugger.
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    */
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    DWORD AntiAttach(DWORD pid)
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    {
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    	DWORD ret = ERROR_SUCCESS;
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    	if( pid )
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    	{
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    		BOOL dbgActProc;
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    		dbgActProc = DebugActiveProcess(pid);
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    		if( dbgActProc )
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    			DebugLoop();
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    		else
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    			ret = GetLastError();
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    	}
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    	else
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    		ret = ERROR_INVALID_HANDLE;
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    	return ret;
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    }
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    /* In the beginning, God said: 'int main!'
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    */
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    int main(int argc, char* argv[])
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    {
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    	DWORD ret = ERROR_SUCCESS;
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    	if( argc > 1 )
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    	{
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    		DWORD pid = atoi(argv[1]);
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    		ret = AntiAttach(pid);
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    	}
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    	return (int) ret;
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    } 
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    
antidebug-ocupando-a-debugport.md:    
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    #include <windows.h>
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    #include <iostream>
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    #include <assert.h>
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    using namespace std;
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    /** This function is triggered when a debugger try to attach into our process.
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    */
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    void AntiAttachAbort()
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    {
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    	// this is a test application, remember?
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    	MessageBox(NULL, "Espertinho, hein?", "AntiAttachDetector", MB_OK | MB_ICONERROR);
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    	// this is the end
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    	TerminateProcess(GetCurrentProcess(), -1);
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    }
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    /** This function installs  a trigger that is activated when a debugger try to attach.
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    @see AntiAttachAbort.
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    */
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    void InstallAntiAttach()
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    {
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    	PVOID attachBreak = GetProcAddress(
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    		GetModuleHandle("ntdll"), // this dll is ALWAYS loaded
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    		"DbgUiRemoteBreakin"); // this function is ALWAYS called on the attach event
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    	assert(attachBreak); // attachBreak NEVER can be null
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    	// opcodes to run a jump to the function AntiAttachAbort
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    	BYTE jmpToAntiAttachAbort[] =
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    	{ 0xB8, 0xCC, 0xCC, 0xCC, 0xCC,   // mov eax, 0xCCCCCCCC
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    	0xFF, 0xE0 };                     // jmp eax
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    	// we change 0xCCCCCCCC using a more useful address
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    	*reinterpret_cast<PVOID*>(&jmpToAntiAttachAbort[1]) = AntiAttachAbort;
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    	DWORD oldProtect = 0;
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    	if( VirtualProtect(attachBreak, sizeof(jmpToAntiAttachAbort), 
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    		PAGE_EXECUTE_READWRITE, &oldProtect) )
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    	{
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    		// if we can change the code page protection we put a jump to our code
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    		CopyMemory(attachBreak, 
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    			jmpToAntiAttachAbort, sizeof(jmpToAntiAttachAbort));
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    		// restore old protection
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    		VirtualProtect(attachBreak, sizeof(jmpToAntiAttachAbort), 
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    			oldProtect, &oldProtect);
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    	}
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    }
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    /** In the beginning, God said: 'int main!'
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    */
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    int main()
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    {
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    	InstallAntiAttach();
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    	cout << "Try to attach, if you can...";
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    	cin.get();
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    } 
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    cl /c antiattach.cpp
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    link antiattach.obj user32.lib
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    antiattach.exe
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    Try to attach, if you can...
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    windbg -pn antiattach.exe
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    <a href="/images/mdRqvjp.png" title="Detecção de attach"><img src="/images/mdRqvjp.png" alt="Detecção de attach"></img></a>
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    // opcodes to run a jump to the function AntiAttachAbort
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    BYTE jmpToAntiAttachAbort[] =
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    { 0xB8, 0xCC, 0xCC, 0xCC, 0xCC,   // mov eax, 0xCCCCCCCC
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    0xFF, 0xE0 };                     // jmp eax
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    // we change 0xCCCCCCCC using a more useful address
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    *reinterpret_cast<PVOID*>(&jmpToAntiAttachAbort[1]) = AntiAttachAbort; 
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    
antidebugging-during-the-process-attach.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    // the well-defined functions are functional blocks of code and have
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    // the same signature, allowing the creation of a pointer array to them
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    void WellDefinedFunction1( args );
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    void WellDefinedFunction2( args );
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    void WellDefinedFunction3( args );
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    //...
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    void WellDefinedFunctionN( args );
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    // this thread stays forever waiting execution commands from some
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    // well-defined function. the parameter that it receives is the function number
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    void ExecutionThread()
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    {
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    	// 2. ad aeternum
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    	while( true )
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    	{
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    		// 5. it runs some well-defined function by number
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    		ExecuteWellDefinedFunction( functionNumber );
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    	}
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    }
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    // the well-defined functions script is an integer array indicating 
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    // the number for the next function that is going to be called
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    int FunctionsToBeCalled[] = { 3, 4, 1, 2, 34, 66, 982, n };
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    int Start()
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    {
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    	// 1. we create the thread that is going to run commands
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    	CreateThread( ExecutionThread );
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    	// 3. for each script item (each function number)
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    	for( int i = 0; i < sizeof(FunctionsToBeCalled); ++i )
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    	{
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    		// 4. tells the thread to run the function number N
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    		TellExecutionThreadToExecuteWellDefinedFunction( FunctionToBeCalled[i] );
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    	}
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    	// 6. end of execution.
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    	return 0;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    } 
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    // filter exceptions that were thrown by the thread below
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    DWORD ExceptionFilterButExecuteWellDefinedFunction()
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    {
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    	// 5. run some well-defined function by number
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    	ExecuteWellDefinedFunction( number );
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    	return EXCEPTION_EXECUTE_HANDLER; // goes to except code
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    }
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    // this thread stays forever waiting execution commands from a 
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    // well-defined function. its "parameter" is the function number
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    void ExecutionThread()
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    {
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    	// 2. ad aeternum
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    	while( true )
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    	{
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    		__try
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    		{
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    			__asm int 3 // breakpoint exception
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    			// it stops the debugger if we have an attached debugger in
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    			// the process, or throws an exception if there is no one
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    		}
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    		__except( ExceptionFilterButExecuteWellDefinedFunction() )
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    		{
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    			// it does nothing. here is NOT where is the code (obvious, huh?)
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    		}
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    		Sleep( someTime ); // give some time
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    	}
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    } 
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    /** @brief Sample demonstrating how to implemente antidebug in a code exception based.
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    @date jul-2007
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    @author Wanderley Caloni
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    */
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    #include <windows.h>
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    #include <iostream>
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    #include <map>
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    #include <sstream>
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    #include <string>
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    #include <stdlib.h>
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    using namespace std;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    // show available commands
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    bool Help(const string&)
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    {
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:       cout << "AntiDebug Test Program\n"
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:          << " Echo string to be printed\n"
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:          << " System command [params]\n"
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:          << " Quit\n\n";
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:       return true;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    }
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    // run system/shell command
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    bool System(const string& cmd)
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    {
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:       system(cmd.c_str());
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:       return true;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    }
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    // print string to output
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    bool Echo(const string& str)
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    {
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:       cout << str << endl;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:       return true;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    }
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    // quit program
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    bool Quit(const string&)
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    {
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:       exit(0);
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:       return false;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    }
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    // minifunctions array
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    bool (* (g_miniFuncs[]) )(const string&) = { Help, System, Echo, Quit };
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    // "minifunction -> index" mapping
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    map<string, int> g_miniFuncIdx;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    // start minifunctions mapping
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    void InitializeMiniFuncIdx()
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    {
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:       g_miniFuncIdx["Help"] = 0;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:       g_miniFuncIdx["System"] = 1;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:       g_miniFuncIdx["Echo"] = 2;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:       g_miniFuncIdx["Quit"] = 3;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    }
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    // last line read from input
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    string g_currentLine;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    // how much time are we going to wait for the next line?
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    const DWORD g_waitTime = 1000;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    // run minifunctions
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    DWORD FilterException()
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    {
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:       DWORD ret = EXCEPTION_CONTINUE_EXECUTION;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:       if( ! g_currentLine.empty() )
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:       {
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:          istringstream line(g_currentLine);
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:          g_currentLine.clear();
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:          string function;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:          string params;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:          line >> function;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:          getline(line, params);
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:          // 5. run some well-defined function by number
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:          if( ! g_miniFuncs[g_miniFuncIdxfunction]  )
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:             ret = EXCEPTION_CONTINUE_SEARCH;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:       }
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:       return ret;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    }
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    DWORD WINAPI AntiDebugThread(PVOID)
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    {
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:       InitializeMiniFuncIdx(); // start minifunction mapping
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:       // 2. ad aeternum (or almost)
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:       while( true )
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:       {
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:          //FilterException();
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:          __try // the extern try waits for an exit command
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:          {
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:             __try // the intern try stays generating exceptions continuously
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:             {
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:                __asm int 3
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:             }
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:             // FilterException is the function who runs minifunctions
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:             __except( FilterException() )
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:             {
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    				// we can put some fake code here
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:             }
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:          }
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:          __except( EXCEPTION_EXECUTE_HANDLER )
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:          {
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:             break; // get out from ad aeternum (to the limbo?)
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:          }
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:          Sleep(g_waitTime);
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:       }
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:       return ERROR_SUCCESS;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    }
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    /** and God said: 'int main!'
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    */
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    int main()
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    {
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:       DWORD ret = ERROR_SUCCESS;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:       DWORD tid = 0;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:       HANDLE antiDebugThr;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:       // 1. we create the thread that is going to run the commands
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:       antiDebugThr = CreateThread(NULL, 0, AntiDebugThread, NULL, 0, &tid);;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:       if( antiDebugThr )
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:       {
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:          // 3. for each item in the script (function numbers)
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:          while( cin )
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:          {
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:             cout << "Type something\n";
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:             // 4. tells the thread to run the function number N
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:             getline(cin, g_currentLine);
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:             if( WaitForSingleObject(antiDebugThr, g_waitTime * 2) != WAIT_TIMEOUT )
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:                break;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:          }
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:          GetExitCodeThread(antiDebugThr, &ret);
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:          CloseHandle(antiDebugThr), antiDebugThr = NULL;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:       }
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:       // 6. end of execution.
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:       return (int) ret;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    } 
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-one.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    // Go back to place pre-defined by the restoration point.
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    void LongJmp(restorePoint)
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    {
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	// Here we will generate an exception to make things difficult.
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	// @todo Make a breakpoint exception and catch it.
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	// 3. We return to the if without using the stack, but from the restoration point.
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	GoBackToTheStartFunction(restorePoint);
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    }
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    // Here everything begins.
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    int Start()
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    {
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	// Obs.: follow the agreement flow according to the numbers.
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	// 1. First pass: we define a restoration point to the return of LongJmp.
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	// 4. Second pass: we go back from the LongJmp function, but this time we get into the else.
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	if( RestorePointDefined() == Defined )
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	{
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    		// 2. We call the function that will return to the if.
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    		LongJmp( if );
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	}
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	else
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	{
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    		// 5. Call the real function, our true target.
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    		CallTheUsefulFunction();
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	}
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	// 6. End of execution.
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	return 0;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    } 
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    void Func()
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    {
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:       return;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    }
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    void CallFunc()
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    {
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:       Func();
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    }
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    Func:
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    00411F73 prev_instruction ; ESP = 0012FD38 (four bytes stacked up)
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    00411F74 ret ; *ESP = 00411FA3 (return address)
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    CallFunc:
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    00411F9C prev_instruction
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    00411F9E call Func (411424h) ; ESP = 0012FD3C
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    00411FA3 next_instruction
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    Func:
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    00411F60 throw_exception
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    00411F61 ...
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    00411F73 catch_exception
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    00411F74 mov ESP, 0012FD3C ; ESP = 0012FD3C, just like CallFunc
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    00411F75 jmp 00411FA3 ; jumps to CallFunc::next_instruction
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    jmp_buf env; // Contains the next instruction (stack state).
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    void Func()
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    {
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	// 3. Return using the "nonconventional" way
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	longjmp(env, 1);
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    }
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    void CallFunc()
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    {
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	// 1. If we're setting, returns 0.
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	// 2. If we're returning, returns a value different from 0.
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	if( setjmp(env) == 0 )
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    		Func();
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	int x = 10; // 4. Next instruction.
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    } 
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    /** The only purpose of this function is to generate an exception.
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    */
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    DWORD LongJmp(jmp_buf* env)
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    {
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	__try
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	{
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    		__asm int 3
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	}
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    		__except( EXCEPTION_EXECUTE_HANDLER )
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	{
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    		longjmp(*env, 1);
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	}
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	return ERROR_SUCCESS;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    }
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    /** And God said: 'int main!'
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    */
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    int main()
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    {
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	DWORD ret = ERROR_SUCCESS;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	while( cin )
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	{
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    		string line;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    		cout << "Type something\n";
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    		getline(cin, line);
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    		jmp_buf env;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    		if( setjmp(env) == 0 )
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    		{
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    			LongJmp(&env);
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    		}
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    		else
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    		{
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    			cout << line << endl;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    		}
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	}
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	return (int) ret;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    } 
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    /** Use this macro instead LongJmp
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    */
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    #define ANTIDEBUG(code)
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    {
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	jmp_buf env;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	if( setjmp(env) == 0 )
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	{
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    		LongJmp(&env);
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	}
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	else
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	{
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    		code;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	}
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    }
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    /** And God said: 'int main!'
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    */
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    int main()
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    {
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	DWORD ret = ERROR_SUCCESS;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	while( cin )
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	{
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    		string line;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    		cout << "Type something\n";
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    		getline(cin, line);
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    		ANTIDEBUG(( cout << line << endl ));
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	}
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    	return (int) ret;
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    } 
antidebugging-using-exceptions-part-two.md:    
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    void DebugLoop()
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    {
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    	bool exitLoop = false;
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    	while( ! exitLoop )
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    	{
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    		DEBUG_EVENT debugEvt;
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    		// Wait for some debug event.
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    		WaitForDebugEvent(&debugEvt, INFINITE);
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    		// Let us see what it is about.
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    		switch( debugEvt.dwDebugEventCode )
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    		{
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    			// This one...
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    			// That one...
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    			// Process is going out. We get out the loop and go away.
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    			case EXIT_PROCESS_DEBUG_EVENT:
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    			exitLoop = true;
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    			break;
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    		}
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    		// We need to unfreeze the thread who sent the debug event.
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    		// Otherwise, it stays frozen forever!
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    		ContinueDebugEvent(debugEvt.dwProcessId, debugEvt.dwThreadId, DBG_EXCEPTION_NOT_HANDLED);
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    	}
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    } 
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    /** @brief Antidebug protection based on DebugPort aquisition.
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    * @author Wanderley Caloni (wanderley@caloni.com.br)
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    * @date 2007-08
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    */
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    #include <windows.h>
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    /* Every debugger needs a debugging loop. In this loop it catches
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    debugging events sent by the operating system.
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    */
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    DWORD DebugLoop()
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    {
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    	DWORD ret = ERROR_SUCCESS;
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    	bool exitLoop = false;
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    	while( ! exitLoop )
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    	{
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    		DEBUG_EVENT debugEvt;
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    		WaitForDebugEvent(&debugEvt, INFINITE);
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    		switch( debugEvt.dwDebugEventCode )
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    		{
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    			// Process going out. We get out the loop and leave.
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    			case EXIT_PROCESS_DEBUG_EVENT:
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    			exitLoop = true;
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    			break;
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    		}
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    		// Necessary, since the current thread is frozen.
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    		ContinueDebugEvent(debugEvt.dwProcessId, debugEvt.dwThreadId, DBG_EXCEPTION_NOT_HANDLED);
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    	}
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    	return ret;
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    }
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    /* Attachs to the protected process againt debugging. Actually, we protect it
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    againt debugging being its debugger.
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    */
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    DWORD AntiAttach(DWORD pid)
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    {
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    	DWORD ret = ERROR_SUCCESS;
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    	if( pid )
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    	{
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    		BOOL dbgActProc;
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    		dbgActProc = DebugActiveProcess(pid);
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    		if( dbgActProc )
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    			DebugLoop();
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    		else
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    			ret = GetLastError();
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    	}
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    	else
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    		ret = ERROR_INVALID_HANDLE;
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    	return ret;
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    }
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    /* In the beginning, God said: 'int main!'
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    */
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    int main(int argc, char* argv[])
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    {
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    	DWORD ret = ERROR_SUCCESS;
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    	if( argc > 1 )
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    	{
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    		DWORD pid = atoi(argv[1]);
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    		ret = AntiAttach(pid);
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    	}
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    	return (int) ret;
antidebugging-using-the-debugport.md:    }

aprenda-a-usar-sua-api.md:    {

aprenda-a-usar-sua-api.md:    
aprenda-a-usar-sua-api.md:    	if( hFile )
aprenda-a-usar-sua-api.md:    	{
aprenda-a-usar-sua-api.md:    		DWORD read = 0;
aprenda-a-usar-sua-api.md:    		CHAR buffer[100];
aprenda-a-usar-sua-api.md:    
aprenda-a-usar-sua-api.md:    		if( ReadFile(hFile, buffer, sizeof(buffer), &read, NULL) )

aprenda-a-usar-sua-api.md:    			WriteBuffer(buffer);
aprenda-a-usar-sua-api.md:    		}
aprenda-a-usar-sua-api.md:    
aprenda-a-usar-sua-api.md:    		CloseHandle(hFile);
aprenda-a-usar-sua-api.md:    	}
aprenda-a-usar-sua-api.md:    }

aprenda-a-usar-sua-api.md:    Platform                                High-order bit   Next 7 bits     Low-order byte
aprenda-a-usar-sua-api.md:    -------------------------------------   --------------   ------------    --------------
aprenda-a-usar-sua-api.md:    Windows NT 3.51                         0                Build number    3
aprenda-a-usar-sua-api.md:    Windows NT 4.0                          0                Build number    4
aprenda-a-usar-sua-api.md:    Windows 2000 or Windows XP              0                Build number    5
aprenda-a-usar-sua-api.md:    Windows 95, Windows 98, or Windows Me   1                Reserved        4
aprenda-a-usar-sua-api.md:    Win32s with Windows 3.1                 1                Build number    3
aprenda-a-usar-sua-api.md:    #include <windows.h>
aprenda-a-usar-sua-api.md:    #include <stdio.h>
aprenda-a-usar-sua-api.md:    
aprenda-a-usar-sua-api.md:    int main()
aprenda-a-usar-sua-api.md:    {
aprenda-a-usar-sua-api.md:    	DWORD winVer = GetVersion();
aprenda-a-usar-sua-api.md:    	BOOL isPlatformNT = winVer >= 0x80000000 ? FALSE : TRUE;
aprenda-a-usar-sua-api.md:    
aprenda-a-usar-sua-api.md:    	if( isPlatformNT )
aprenda-a-usar-sua-api.md:    		printf("Plataforma NT\n");
aprenda-a-usar-sua-api.md:    	else
aprenda-a-usar-sua-api.md:    		printf("Bem-vindo ao parque dos dinossauros!\n");
aprenda-a-usar-sua-api.md:    
aprenda-a-usar-sua-api.md:    	return isPlatformNT ? 1 : 0;
aprenda-a-usar-sua-api.md:    }

aquisicao-de-recurso-e-inicializacao.md:    #include <windows.h>
aquisicao-de-recurso-e-inicializacao.md:    
aquisicao-de-recurso-e-inicializacao.md:    class File
aquisicao-de-recurso-e-inicializacao.md:    {
aquisicao-de-recurso-e-inicializacao.md:    	public:
aquisicao-de-recurso-e-inicializacao.md:    	File(const char* fileName)
aquisicao-de-recurso-e-inicializacao.md:    	{
aquisicao-de-recurso-e-inicializacao.md:    		m_file = CreateFile(fileName, GENERIC_READ, FILE_SHARE_READ, 
aquisicao-de-recurso-e-inicializacao.md:    		NULL, OPEN_EXISTING, 0, NULL); // if we open the file...
aquisicao-de-recurso-e-inicializacao.md:    	}
aquisicao-de-recurso-e-inicializacao.md:    
aquisicao-de-recurso-e-inicializacao.md:    	~File()
aquisicao-de-recurso-e-inicializacao.md:    	{
aquisicao-de-recurso-e-inicializacao.md:    		CloseHandle(m_file); // ... we need to close it!
aquisicao-de-recurso-e-inicializacao.md:    		m_file = NULL;
aquisicao-de-recurso-e-inicializacao.md:    	}
aquisicao-de-recurso-e-inicializacao.md:    
aquisicao-de-recurso-e-inicializacao.md:    	HANDLE m_file; // aquired resource
aquisicao-de-recurso-e-inicializacao.md:    };
aquisicao-de-recurso-e-inicializacao.md:    
aquisicao-de-recurso-e-inicializacao.md:    int UseFile()
aquisicao-de-recurso-e-inicializacao.md:    {
aquisicao-de-recurso-e-inicializacao.md:    	File config("config.txt"); // local object: aquired resource
aquisicao-de-recurso-e-inicializacao.md:    	// using config.txt
aquisicao-de-recurso-e-inicializacao.md:    	return 0; // the aquired resource  (config.txt) is automagically released
aquisicao-de-recurso-e-inicializacao.md:    } 
aquisicao-de-recurso-e-inicializacao.md:

aquisicao-de-recurso-e-inicializacao.md:    {
aquisicao-de-recurso-e-inicializacao.md:    	// the things are not that good. so...
aquisicao-de-recurso-e-inicializacao.md:    	throw Scatadush();
aquisicao-de-recurso-e-inicializacao.md:    }
